intro: Diplolaena geraldtonensis, commonly known as Geraldton daphne, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Diplolaena geraldtonensis is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
